text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-Consent.provision

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*Extension(4.0.1)Constraints to the base Consent.policyRule/Consent.policy
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:period 0..1ExtensionTimeframe for this provision
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.period"
value[x] 0..1PeriodTimeframe for this provision
extension:actor 0..*ExtensionWho|what controlled by this provision (or group, by role)
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:role 0..1ExtensionHow the actor is involved
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.actor.role"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptHow the actor is involved
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-participation-role-type-for-R4 (extensible): How an actor is involved in the consent considerations.
extension:reference 0..1ExtensionResource for the actor (or group, by role)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.actor.reference"
value[x] 0..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Device for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Device | Cross-version Profile for R5.Group for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Group | Cross-version Profile for R5.CareTeam for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | CareTeam | Cross-version Profile for R5.Organization for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Organization | Cross-version Profile for R5.Patient for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Patient | Cross-version Profile for R5.Practitioner for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Practitioner | Cross-version Profile for R5.RelatedPerson for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | RelatedPerson | Cross-version Profile for R5.PractitionerRole for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | PractitionerRole)Resource for the actor (or group, by role)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.actor"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:action 0..*ExtensionActions controlled by this provision
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.action"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptActions controlled by this provision
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-action-for-R4 (example): Detailed codes for the consent action.
extension:securityLabel 0..*ExtensionSecurity Labels that define affected resources
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.securityLabel"
value[x] 0..1CodingSecurity Labels that define affected resources
extension:purpose 0..*ExtensionContext of activities covered by this provision
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.purpose"
value[x] 0..1CodingContext of activities covered by this provision
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-v3-PurposeOfUse-for-R4 (extensible): What purposes of use are controlled by this exception. If more than one label is specified, operations must have all the specified labels.
extension:documentType 0..*Extensione.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.documentType"
value[x] 0..1Codinge.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-content-class-for-R4 (preferred): The document type a consent provision covers.
extension:resourceType 0..*Extensione.g. Resource Type, Profile, etc
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.resourceType"
value[x] 0..1Codinge.g. Resource Type, Profile, etc
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-resource-types-for-R4 (extensible): The resource types a consent provision covers.
extension:code 0..*Extensione.g. LOINC or SNOMED CT code, etc. in the content
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.code"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConcepte.g. LOINC or SNOMED CT code, etc. in the content
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-content-code-for-R4 (example): If this code is found in an instance, then the exception applies.
extension:dataPeriod 0..1ExtensionTimeframe for data controlled by this provision
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.dataPeriod"
value[x] 0..1PeriodTimeframe for data controlled by this provision
extension:data 0..*ExtensionData controlled by this provision
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:meaning 1..1Extensioninstance | related | dependents | authoredby
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.data.meaning"
value[x] 1..1codeinstance | related | dependents | authoredby
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-data-meaning-for-R4 (required): How a resource reference is interpreted when testing consent restrictions.
extension:reference 1..1ExtensionThe actual data reference
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.data.reference"
value[x] 1..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Resource for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Resource)The actual data reference
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.data"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:expression 0..1ExtensionA computable expression of the consent
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision.expression"
value[x] 0..1ExpressionA computable expression of the consent
extension:provision 0..*ExtensionNested Exception Provisions
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionConsent_Provision
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Consent.provision` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Consent.provision` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Consent.provision` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Consent.provision` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `Consent.provision` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `Consent.provision` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `Consent.provision` 0..1 `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Consent.provision` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision`, but has no comparisons.
Note available implied context: `Consent.provision.provision` because `Consent.provision.provision` is defined as a content reference to `Consent.provision`.

element.definition: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Timeframe for this provision.
element.comment: This is the bound effective time of the consent and should be in the base provision in the Consent resource.
element.requirements:

element.short: Security Labels that define affected resources
element.definition: A security label, comprised of 0..* security label fields (Privacy tags), which define which resources are controlled by this exception.
element.comment: If the consent specifies a security label of "R" then it applies to all resources that are labeled "R" or lower. E.g. for Confidentiality, it's a high water mark. For other kinds of security labels, subsumption logic applies. When the purpose of use tag is on the data, access request purpose of use shall not conflict.

element.comment: This has a different sense to the Consent.period - that is when the consent agreement holds. This is the time period of the data that is controlled by the agreement.

element.definition: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.
Timeframe for this provision.
element.comment: This is the bound effective time of the consent and should be in the base provision in the Consent resource.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.period` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.period` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.period`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: Timeframe for this provision.
element.comment: This is the bound effective time of the consent and should be in the base provision in the Consent resource.

element.short: Who|what controlled by this provision (or group, by role)
element.definition: Who or what is controlled by this provision. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.actor` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.actor` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.actor`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: How the individual is involved in the resources content that is described in the exception.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.actor.role` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision.actor` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.actor.role` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.actor.role`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: How the individual is involved in the resources content that is described in the exception.

binding.description: How an actor is involved in the consent considerations.

element.short: Resource for the actor (or group, by role)
element.definition: The resource that identifies the actor. To identify actors by type, use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.actor.reference` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision.actor` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.actor.reference` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.actor.reference`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Resource for the actor (or group, by role)
element.definition: The resource that identifies the actor. To identify actors by type, use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').
Actions controlled by this provision.
element.comment: Note that this is the direct action (not the grounds for the action covered in the purpose element). At present, the only action in the understood and tested scope of this resource is 'read'.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.action` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.action` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.action`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: Actions controlled by this provision.
element.comment: Note that this is the direct action (not the grounds for the action covered in the purpose element). At present, the only action in the understood and tested scope of this resource is 'read'.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the consent action.

element.short: Security Labels that define affected resources
element.definition: A security label, comprised of 0..* security label fields (Privacy tags), which define which resources are controlled by this exception.
element.comment: If the consent specifies a security label of "R" then it applies to all resources that are labeled "R" or lower. E.g. for Confidentiality, it's a high water mark. For other kinds of security labels, subsumption logic applies. When the purpose of use tag is on the data, access request purpose of use shall not conflict.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.securityLabel` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.securityLabel` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.securityLabel`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Security Labels that define affected resources
element.definition: A security label, comprised of 0..* security label fields (Privacy tags), which define which resources are controlled by this exception.
element.comment: If the consent specifies a security label of "R" then it applies to all resources that are labeled "R" or lower. E.g. for Confidentiality, it's a high water mark. For other kinds of security labels, subsumption logic applies. When the purpose of use tag is on the data, access request purpose of use shall not conflict.

element.short: Context of activities covered by this provision
element.definition: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this provision.
element.comment: When the purpose of use tag is on the data, access request purpose of use shall not conflict.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.purpose` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.purpose` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.purpose`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Context of activities covered by this provision
element.definition: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this provision.
element.comment: When the purpose of use tag is on the data, access request purpose of use shall not conflict.

binding.description: What purposes of use are controlled by this exception. If more than one label is specified, operations must have all the specified labels.

element.short: e.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc
element.definition: The documentType(s) covered by this provision. The type can be a CDA document, or some other type that indicates what sort of information the consent relates to.
element.comment: Multiple types are or'ed together. The intention of the documentType element is that the codes refer to document types defined in a standard somewhere.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.documentType` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.documentType` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.class`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: e.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc
element.definition: The documentType(s) covered by this provision. The type can be a CDA document, or some other type that indicates what sort of information the consent relates to.
element.comment: Multiple types are or'ed together. The intention of the documentType element is that the codes refer to document types defined in a standard somewhere.

binding.description: The document type a consent provision covers.

element.definition: The resourceType(s) covered by this provision. The type can be a FHIR resource type or a profile on a type that indicates what information the consent relates to.
element.comment: Multiple types are or'ed together. The intention of the resourceType element is that the codes refer to profiles or document types defined in a standard or an implementation guide somewhere.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.provision.resourceType` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.provision` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.provision.resourceType` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.provision.class`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: The resourceType(s) covered by this provision. The type can be a FHIR resource type or a profile on a type that indicates what information the consent relates to.
element.comment: Multiple types are or'ed together. The intention of the resourceType element is that the codes refer to profiles or document types defined in a standard or an implementation guide somewhere.

binding.description: The resource types a consent provision covers.
